com.synthbot.audioplugin.vst.vst2
Class JVstHost2

java.lang.Object
  com.synthbot.audioplugin.vst.vst2.JVstHost2
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.synthbot.audioplugin.vst.view.JVstViewListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
JVstHost20
public abstract class JVstHost2
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.synthbot.audioplugin.vst.view.JVstViewListener

JVstHost2 is an abstract class which generally defines the interface of a VST 2.x plugin. New instances can only be instantiated by using newInstance. A subclass is returned which implements all of the methods of the corresponding VST version. These subclasses are JVstHost20, JVstHost21, JVstHost22, JVstHost23, and JVstHost24. If you need a method which is specific to one of the VST versions, such as processDoubleReplacing in JVstHost24, then you must cast the resulting JVstHost2 to that class. You can check which VST version the plugin implements with getVstVersion. Note that some basic methods, such as process, are deprecated in later VST versions (e.g., 2.4), and will throw an exception if used. I have tried to keep the method names as similar to the original C/C++ specification as possible. Unfortunately the original functions are not always consistently or sensibly named. Complain to Steinberg. Most methods in this and subclasses will check to make sure that the native library is loaded before executing any native code. If a method is called and the native library is not loaded, then an IllegalStateException will be thrown. All public methods of JVstHost2 and its subclasses are synchronized. They are thread-safe.

Method Detail

newInstance

public static JVstHost2 newInstance(java.io.File file,
                                    float sampleRate,
                                    int blockSize)
                             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                    JVstLoadException
Instantiates a subclass of JVstHost, depending on the VST version. The returned plugin is fully started and ready to process audio and events.

Parameters:
file - The location of the native plugin library.
sampleRate - The sample rate at which the plugin should operate.
blockSize - The maximum size of an audio block
Returns:
A new instance of a JVstHost2 subclass corresponding to the plugin's vst version.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - Thrown if the given VST File does not exist.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the supplied sample rate or block size exceed their allowed values. See setSampleRate and setBlockSize.
JVstLoadException - Thrown if there are any errors while loading the native VST.
java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the given VST File is null.
For - more information on exceptions, see http://github.com/mhroth/jvsthost/wikis/micro-blog/

newInstance

public static JVstHost2 newInstance(java.io.File file)
                             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                    JVstLoadException
Instantiates a subclass of JVstHost, depending on the VST version. The resulting plugin is only initialised, and not started, nor supplied with necessary information, such as sample rate or block size.

Parameters:
file - The location of the native plugin library.
Returns:
A new instance of a JVstHost2 subclass corresponding to the plugin's vst version.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - Thrown if the given VST File does not exist.
JVstLoadException - Thrown if there are any errors while loading the native VST.
java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the given VST File is null.
For - more information on exceptions, see http://github.com/mhroth/jvsthost/wikis/micro-blog/

isNativeComponentLoaded

public boolean isNativeComponentLoaded()
Indicates if the native component of the plugin is loaded. Any use of the JVstHost2 object while the plugin is not loaded will throw an IllegalStateException.

Returns:
True if the native component is successfully loaded. False otherwise.

turnOffAndUnloadPlugin

public abstract void turnOffAndUnloadPlugin()
Stop and unload the native component of the plugin. Any further use of this object will cause an IllegalStateException to be thrown. This method is publicly exposed in order to allow the potentially heavy native component to be manually managed. Java garbage collection does not act appropriately under these circumstances, as the JVstHost java object is lightweight, and may not be expunged in a timely manner. This leaves the large native component in memory while the java object awaits garbage collection. This method is automatically invoked by the java finalizer if the native object is still loaded; it is not necessary for this method to be manually invoked.

unloadPlugin

protected static void unloadPlugin(long pluginPtr)
Unload and dispose of the native vst.

Parameters:
pluginPtr - A pointer to the native component.

queueMidiMessage

public abstract void queueMidiMessage(javax.sound.midi.ShortMessage message)
Queues the given midi message until the next time that a process variant is called. The queue is cleared upon the execution of process.

Specified by:
queueMidiMessage in interface com.synthbot.audioplugin.vst.view.JVstViewListener
Parameters:
message - A MIDI message to be queued.

processReplacing

public abstract void processReplacing(float[][] inputs,
                                      float[][] outputs,
                                      int blockSize)
Generate audio output from the plugin, replacing the contents of the output array. Queued MIDI messages, via queueMidiMessage, will be passed to the plugin.

Parameters:
inputs - The audio input to the plugin is read from this array.
outputs - The output of the plugin will be placed into this array.
blockSize - Number of samples to read from the input and output buffers. May not be larger than the length of the arrays.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if any of the arguments do not lie within their natural bounds.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the plugin does not implement processReplacing. Check canReplacing.
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError - Thrown in the rare case that native input and output arrays cannot be allocated by the JVM.
java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the input or output arrays are null.

canReplacing

public abstract boolean canReplacing()
Determines if the plugin implements processReplacing(). It is an error to call processReplacing() if the method is not implemented.

Returns:
True if the plugin implements processReplacing(). False otherwise.

process

public abstract void process(float[][] inputs,
                             float[][] outputs,
                             int blockSize)
Generate audio output from the plugin, adding the output to the output array. Queued MIDI messages, via queueMidiMessage, will be passed to the plugin.

Parameters:
inputs - The audio input to the plugin is read from this array.
outputs - The output of the plugin will be placed into this array.
blockSize - Number of samples to read from the input and output buffers. May not be larger than the length of the arrays.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if any of the arguments do not lie within their natural bounds.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the plugin does not implement processReplacing(). Check canReplacing().
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError - Thrown in the rare case that native input and output arrays cannot be allocated by the JVM.
java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the input or output arrays are null.

setBlockSize

public abstract void setBlockSize(int blockSize)
Set the maximum block size which the plugin should expect to process data. The block size can be made smaller when calling processReplacing().

Parameters:
blockSize - The new block size.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown in the block size is negative.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the plugin is turned on.

setTempo

public abstract void setTempo(double tempo)
Set the current tempo in beats per minute (BPM). Some plugins have tempo-based effects, such as synchronised LFOs, etc. This value will influence their function. A default value of 120 BPM is used.

Parameters:
tempo - The new tempo in beats per minute.

openEditor

public abstract void openEditor(java.lang.String frameTitle)
Open the native editor window. This method does nothing if the editor is already open. NOTE: This method is currently only implemented on Windows.

Parameters:
frameTitle - The title of the native editor frame. This can be used to uniquely identify individual windows.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the plugin has no native editor. Check to see if the plugin has a native editor with hasEditor.
java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if frameTitle is null.

isEditorOpen

public abstract boolean isEditorOpen()
Checks if the editor is currently open.

Returns:
True if the native editor of the plugin is currently open. False otherwise.

closeEditor

public abstract void closeEditor()
Close the native editor window. NOTE: This method is not yet implemented.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the plugin has no native editor. Check to see if the plugin has a native editor with hasEditor.

hasEditor

public abstract boolean hasEditor()
Determines if the plugin implements a graphical editor from which it can be manipulated.

Returns:
True if the plugin has an editor. False otherwise.

getPluginPath

public java.lang.String getPluginPath()
Returns the absolute path of the plugin file.

Returns:
The absolute path of the plugin file.

turnOn

public abstract void turnOn()
Ensure that the plugin is initialised and ready to process. Plugins must be turned on in order to process audio or midi events. Successive invocations of this method have no effect.

turnOff

public abstract void turnOff()
Suspend the plugin's operation. Plugins must usually be turned off in order to set critical parameters such as sample rate or block size. Successive invocations of this method have no effect.

setBypass

public abstract void setBypass(boolean bypass)
Changes the bypass mode of the plugin, if it supports the option.

Parameters:
bypass - True if bypass should be turned on. False otherwise.
